TEAM.TITLE: Aider l'Inde rurale, une vidéo à la fois
TEAM.HEADLINE: L'Inde rurale, qui abrite plus de 60% de la population indienne et plus de 300 millions de pauvres, est mal en point. Un organisme, né dans les laboratoires de Microsoft, espère changer la donne.
TEAM.DESC: "Un fonctionnaire indien arrive dans un village. Il choisit un fermier influent. Lui enseigne une nouvelle technique pour améliorer sa production et repart, promettant de revenir. Neuf fois sur dix, ses enseignements restent lettre morte."

TEAM.TITLE: Digital Green meets Hillary Clinton
TEAM.HEADLINE: Clinton calls for larger collaboration between Indian, U.S entrepreneurs.
TEAM.DESC: "For decades, scientists, engineers and social innovators from India and United States have worked side-by-side, the most famous example perhaps are the agricultural improvements that led to the Green Revolution. Today I met entrepreneurs from an organisation called 'Digital Green', who are carrying on that work."

TEAM.TITLE: Norman Borlaug Award
TEAM.HEADLINE: IFA Recognizes Two Laureates for Norman Borlaug Award
TEAM.DESC: "The International Fertilizer Association (IFA) will recognize two laureates for the 2012 IFA Norman Borlaug Award. Dr. Greta Gabinete of the Philippines, the second woman in the history of the award and Mr. Rikin Gandhi of India, have completed work in providing extension services to farmers. "

TEAM.TITLE: BillGates
TEAM.HEADLINE: International Fund for Agricultural Development Governing Council
TEAM.DESC: "Technology as simple as a digital video camera can remake agricultural extension. In India, a group of women farmers started videotaping themselves providing training in farming techniques. They called the project Digital Green, and they have a plan to reach 1 million farmers across 10,000 villages in the next three years. "

TEAM.TITLE: TechSangam
TEAM.HEADLINE: An agricultural extension innovation going viral: Digital Green
TEAM.DESC: "A first-time visitor to Digital Green's website could be forgiven for thinking she stumbled on to a Web 2.0 video sharing site. A crisp and clean UI with dynamic menus, an appealing 5X4 featured videos grid on the left, and 3 prominent engagement metrics on the right present a spiffy picture. "

TEAM.TITLE: Young Turks, CNBC TV 18
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green and CNBC
TEAM.DESC: "An introduction of Rikin Gandhis' journey from MIT to forming Digital Green in India to help farmers at ground zero "

TEAM.TITLE: Governance Knowledge Centre
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green combines technology and social organization to improve the cost-effectiveness and broaden the community participation of existing agricultural extension systems. "

TEAM.TITLE: One World South Asia
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green: For more productive agriculture
TEAM.DESC: "The low-cost Digital Green initiative in India prepares video DVDs of live demonstrations of agricultural practices by experts to be distributed among small farmers in remote areas. "

TEAM.TITLE: Next Billion
TEAM.HEADLINE: How to Reach Out to Rural India? Practitioners and Academics In Dialogue
TEAM.DESC: "There is no shortage of ideas, and some would even say no shortage of products, that would help the rural poor to improve their social and economic situation. "

TEAM.TITLE: iBN Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: MIT Graduate making a difference in Rural India
TEAM.DESC: "Archimedes:Give me a lever long enough and a fulcrum on which to place it, and I shall move the world."

TEAM.TITLE: Silicon India
TEAM.HEADLINE: Find your Lever
TEAM.DESC: "No business operates with unlimited resources. Resources either financial or human are limited hence business must utilize them with end in mind. Smaller challenges are like smaller bumps, you step over it whereas bigger challenges are like mountains. You can either continue bumping into it or dig a tunnel underneath to cross under or get into the hot air balloon to cross over"

TEAM.TITLE: Business Standard
TEAM.HEADLINE: Aspiring Astronaut helps farmers
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin Gandhi's novel idea to film and screen 'best practice' videos of farming techniques across villages in India has wooed both farmers and the government."

TEAM.TITLE: The Pioneer
TEAM.HEADLINE: So, he started his own organisation to help farmers improve their produce through a video camera. Eram Agha tracks the young Gandhi to find out more about him
TEAM.DESC: "Neither the Greenfields lyrics by The Brothers Four, nor Shah Rukh Khan's role in Swades inspired Rikin Gandhi, CEO of Digital Green, to chuck his NASA dreams for addressing the issues of farmers in India."

TEAM.TITLE: The Hindu
TEAM.HEADLINE: Latest technology helps ryots get good yield
TEAM.DESC: "Volunteers from Pragati, an NGO working on agriculture in Koraput district, visit the village on Friday evenings with a film projector and the villagers turn up to watch various programmes on agriculture."

TEAM.TITLE: ILRI Clippings
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video with farmers help to amplify agricultural extension and learnings
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin Ghandi spoke to people on the ILRI campus about the work of Digital Green to reinforce agricultural extension through the use of participatory video with farmers."

TEAM.TITLE: e-Agriculture
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green - 'ICT' and 'AG Profile'
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green, a farm extension service using video camera and pico projectors in India"

TEAM.TITLE: DNA
TEAM.HEADLINE: MIT alumnus chucks space dreams for terra firma - Money
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin Gandhi started reading autobiographies and books on astronauts after he received his pilot's licence and was preparing to join the US astronaut programme."

TEAM.TITLE: The Hindu
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video clippings educate on methods practised elseware
TEAM.DESC: "Though immediately after my graduation I thought of joining some space programme, I happened to read about people travelling to space and seeing the earth from high up and wondering why poverty and war exist on this beautiful planet."

TEAM.TITLE: The Weekend Leader
TEAM.HEADLINE: Through Digital Green, Rikin Gandhi helps farmers prosper
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green's aim is to raise the livelihoods of smallholder farmers across the developing world through the targeted production and dissemination of agricultural information via participatory video and mediated instruction through grassroots-level partnerships."

TEAM.TITLE: Business Standard
TEAM.HEADLINE: Gururaj Deshpande's Indian sandbox of social innovation
TEAM.DESC: "Another project includes training marginal and small farmers - who often lack modern agricultural knowledge that could quickly and easily improve their productivity levels and enhance their livelihoods - by utilising low-cost technologies such as handycams, projectors, TVs and DVD players. It's called the Digital Green project."

TEAM.TITLE: Explocity
TEAM.HEADLINE: Great leap for Mankind
TEAM.DESC: "While the rest of us were openly shadowing US President Barack Obama on his visit to India through news channels, Obama himself was busy admiring the work of Rikin Gandhi and his team at the Agriculture and Food Security Expo in Mumbai. Gandhi, the 29-year-old CEO of Digital Green, promotes sustainable agriculture through videos of better practices recorded for and by farmers across the country."

TEAM.TITLE: Daily Brink
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green is revolutionizing an industry as old as civilization itself
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green is an agro-business non-profit. When I was working at Microsoft in Bangalore, India, the Emerging Markets department wanted to find ways to use simple technology to better the lives of marginalized communities. We became an independent organization with advisory support from Microsoft."

TEAM.TITLE: The White House
TEAM.HEADLINE: Expo on Agriculture and Food Security
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green had the extraordinary opportunity to demonstrate its system to U.S. President Barack Obama during his visit to Bombay, India"

TEAM.TITLE: Mint ePaper
TEAM.HEADLINE: Videos by the farmers and for the farmers
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green has partnered with non-governmental organizations to train youth farmers to shoot, edit and screen films."

TEAM.TITLE: The Telegraph
TEAM.HEADLINE: Videos that help farmers watch, learn and earn more
TEAM.DESC: "An initiative of two NGOs, Delhi-based Digital Green and Jharkhand's Pradhan - the videos are bringing about a transformation in an environment where there is no electricity, let alone televisions."

TEAM.TITLE: The Hindu
TEAM.HEADLINE: Starring Farmers, video goes 'grassroots' here
TEAM.DESC: "Having grown up in the U.S., at 28, Gandhi says this was his first 'tryst with rural India'. After travelling and interacting with farmers for months, he found that romantic notions of ICT being used to transform the lot of Indian farmers were far from reality."

TEAM.TITLE: NDTV
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green catalyses a quiet revolution in India
TEAM.DESC: "Delhi-based Digital Green focuses on educating farmers about farming techniques through locally produced videos in which local cultivators are featured. The project works in over 200 villages across Jharkhand, Orissa, Karnataka and Madhya Pradesh with seven NGOs, helping famers improve their living standards and productivity."

TEAM.TITLE: YOURSTORY TEAM
TEAM.HEADLINE: Rikin Gandhi, CEO, Digital Green: Social Entrepreneur who disseminates education to farmers through videos
TEAM.DESC: "RikinGandhi, is the CEO of Digital Green, which is helping farmers in the developing world through production and dissemination of educative videos. Digital Green produces and distributes community centric, locally relevant videos about best agricultural practices."

TEAM.TITLE: Deccan Herald
TEAM.HEADLINE: A high-flier takes a Swadesh Trip
TEAM.DESC: "He trained farmers to make videos with handy cams about their innovative practices and share them with others. The solution is more complex than this in reality; it involves experts, NGOs, government officers, communities, all tied together in an expanding network and interacting with each other through a sophisticated technology platform."

TEAM.TITLE: Deccan Herald
TEAM.HEADLINE: 3 Indians named in MIT's Technological Review
TEAM.DESC: "Gandhi demonstrated that for every dollar spent, the system persuaded seven times as many farmers to adopt new ideas as an existing programme of training and visits."

TEAM.TITLE: Technology Review
TEAM.HEADLINE: 2010 Young Innovator
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin Gandhi, founder of the nonprofit Digital Green, has developed a pilot project that offers a solution: simple videos starring local farmers themselves."

TEAM.TITLE: The Times of India
TEAM.HEADLINE: 3 Indians appear in MIT's prestigious Technology Review list
TEAM.DESC: "Gandhi is the founder of the nonprofit 'Digital Green' that focuses on educating farmers about farming techniques through locally produced videos, in which local farmers are featured"

TEAM.TITLE: The ICT4D Jester Blog
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green is actually people Green
TEAM.DESC: "The video sessions are the heart of Digital Green, a system for agriculture extension for smallholder farmers. Digital Green uses a combination of locally produced digital video and mediated group instruction to teach farmers more productive, sustainable agricultural techniques."

TEAM.TITLE: The Ecomomic Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: Young Entrepreneurs making the most of opportunities in Rural India
TEAM.DESC: "In a quirk of fate, his friend's venture failed to take off and Gandhi too grounded his plans to fly fighter jets; instead he worked upon a rural venture that would educate farmers about crop-patterns, climatic conditions and market pricing, through visual medium."

TEAM.TITLE: Business Standard
TEAM.HEADLINE: Mittal, two other Indians in Fortune's visionary list
TEAM.DESC: "The league of eight individuals features two other Indians-Rikin Gandhi, the chief of New Delhi-based NGO Digital Green, and Indrani Medhi, an executive at Microsoft India. The Rikin Gandhi-headed Digital Green teaches farmers in small villages the latest agricultural techniques with the help of multimedia presentations and personal demonstrations."

TEAM.TITLE: Fortune
TEAM.HEADLINE: The Fortune Global Forum Visionaries
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin Gandhi features in the prestigious - The Fortune Global Forum Visionaries"

TEAM.TITLE: The Economic Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: India's a land of hope for some NRIs
TEAM.DESC: "Supported more recently by Deshpande Foundation and Bill & Melinda Gates Foundation, Delhi-based Digital Green collaborates with local organizations to use videos of best agricultural practices to enhance the environmental and economic sustainability of small and marginal farmers in 200 villages in Karnataka, Jharkhand, Madhya Pradesh and Orissa. Digital Green CEO Gandhi, an Indian expat from the US , says We do not follow the usual top-down model. Our working model is driven by people and for people"

TEAM.TITLE: The Financial Express
TEAM.HEADLINE: India emerging as hub of eco-entrepreneurs
TEAM.DESC: "We are encouraging a large number of farmers to see and practise the novel ways of farming to increase their earnings," says Mr Gandhi, who instead of prattling away in American accent, is trying to brush up his Kannada so that he can interact with farmers better."

TEAM.TITLE: Harvard Business Review
TEAM.HEADLINE: Microsoft Reinvents Its Global R&D Model
TEAM.DESC: "My personal favourite is Digital Green (which I nicknamed 'American Idol for Farmers'), a Web 2.0 initiative which tapes progressive farmers to disseminate their best practices across agricultural communities. Digital Green just won the 2008 Stockholm Challenge Award in the Culture category."

TEAM.TITLE: CTA
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video in Development: Filming for Rural Change (Book)
TEAM.DESC: "Video can [show] long natural or agricultural processes in a short period of time, ideally in the local setting, as in the case of Digital Green."

TEAM.TITLE: Hindustan Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: 'Giving circles' that goes beyond monetary funding
TEAM.DESC: "Philanthropy should then address not just the financial needs, but also the physical, human, social, and technological."

TEAM.TITLE: Hindustan Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: Instead of space, he landed on farm land
TEAM.DESC: "They had a new perspective of the world from space and became do-gooders on Earth."

TEAM.TITLE: Press Trust of India
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital tech to help farmers improve livelihood
TEAM.DESC: "We anticipate that with support from the Gates Foundation, Rikin and his team at Digital Green will have impact over 1,000 villages, each consisting of 1,000-2,000 people. Indeed, they are already on the way there."

TEAM.TITLE: Sify
TEAM.HEADLINE: 'Technology Review' identifies Top 20 Indian innovators under 35
TEAM.DESC: "Bangalore's Digital Green founder Rikin B. Gandhi is the social innovator of the year."

TEAM.TITLE: StockWatch
TEAM.HEADLINE: Many Indians honored at MIT's EmTech
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin B. Gandhi, 28, Founder of Digital Green, Bangalore was named the Social Innovator of the Year for finding a solution to help farmers adopt better farmer practices."

TEAM.TITLE: SiliconIndia
TEAM.HEADLINE: Indian academia not upto industry standard
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin B. Gandhi, 28, Founder of Digital Green, Bangalore was named the Social Innovator of the Year for finding a solution to help farmers adopt better farmer practices."

TEAM.TITLE: CIOL
TEAM.HEADLINE: 20 young Indians honoured at Em Tech 2010
TEAM.DESC: "Rikin B. Gandhi, 28, Founder of Digital Green, Bangalore was named the Social Innovator of the Year for finding a solution to help farmers adopt better farmer practices."

TEAM.TITLE: Sify Business
TEAM.HEADLINE: Digital Green to help Educate Farmers
TEAM.DESC: "From crop rotation to organic farming practices, local farmers are always interested in learning the latest agricultural practices. The trouble is how to transfer this information in a language and medium they can understand. And more important, convince them to adopt better farming practices."

TEAM.TITLE: POP City
TEAM.HEADLINE: Pittsburgh's Sima Products teams up with Digital Green to teach sustainable farming in India
TEAM.DESC: "Sima (a global consumer electronics company based here) began supplying Digital Green with incredibly lightweight, battery-powered projectors that are easy to transport and use. Until now they had to carry these heavy projectors," says Sima's CEO Ilana Diamond. "Ours, you can put in your pocket. So they can go to more places, they're not dependent on electricity. If you're riding a bicycle, the weight makes a huge difference."

TEAM.TITLE: Asia Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: India's rural inventors drive change
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green helps increase the productivity of small farmers through low-cost information exchange, such as personal interactions among farmers and with experts. Digital Green videotapes agricultural improvements by farmers in a village and shares the innovations with other villages. The You-Tube-like information sharing aims to help small farmers across the developing world."

TEAM.TITLE: Live Mint
TEAM.HEADLINE: Local Research aids Microsoft in breaking new ground
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green is a project that applies commodity video hardware or real time three dimensional video to step up awareness and spread the use of sustainable agriculture practices among small farmers. It is active in some northern states of India, and has now been spun off as a separate non-government entity."

TEAM.TITLE: EE Times India
TEAM.HEADLINE: ICT research to boost India socio-economic dev't
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green - In order to help farmers improve their agriculture practices, leveraged the use of a regular camcorder to record best agriculture practices and disseminated to other farmers through mediator-based screenings."

TEAM.TITLE: CXO Today
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates on a free Wheel
TEAM.DESC: "We are going Digital Green, getting videos that can facilitate local farmers, and disseminate information and farming technology through DVDs. We can impact the life of people through the usage of technology."

TEAM.TITLE: Science / AAAS
TEAM.HEADLINE: Science: Sustainable Goal
TEAM.DESC: "Within the next 3 months, Digital Green will leave the fold and become an independent nonprofit organization. Gandhi's goal is to reach 3000 villages with farming techniques that can help villagers out of poverty."

TEAM.TITLE: New York Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: Microsoft Goes Far Afield to Study Emerging Markets
TEAM.DESC: "'The farmers love being on TV,' said Kentaro Toyama, assistant managing director of Microsoft Research India and the head of the Technology for Emerging Markets research group. 'This gives us some core knowledge about what works in this particular environment."

TEAM.TITLE: The Forbes
TEAM.HEADLINE: Computing at the Bottom of the Pyramid
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green, which has now been spun off as a not-for-profit, is being implemented in 29 villages in three Indian states. On a recent day in May two dozen residents of the village of Banihalli, 50 miles southeast of Bangalore, were gathered in a courtyard to watch and discuss a DVD on worm composting."

TEAM.TITLE: The Economic Times
TEAM.HEADLINE: Computer wizards join hands with sociologists
TEAM.DESC: "Bill Gates may have stepped down from an active role at Microsoft, but he has been pursuing his passion to serve the world through his outreach programmes. During his tour of universities recently, he happened to talk about a 'Digital Green' programme initiated by the Microsoft Research Lab, India, in Kanakapura villages."

TEAM.TITLE: The Times of India
TEAM.HEADLINE: Microsoft helps farmers by creating videos on best practices
TEAM.DESC: "We differentiate farming techniques with good results and those without and communicate the difference to farmers. An example is seeding technique. Random versus systematic seeding shows that the latter consumes less water, increases yield and occupies less space. The same is communicated to farmers."

TEAM.TITLE: The Hindu Business Line
TEAM.HEADLINE: Spread the Farmers word
TEAM.DESC: "The project has helped to extend the efforts of GREEN Foundation. Raghavendra Rao, Chief Executive, GREEN Foundation, says they were doing it in the traditional way. They had field managers who went from farmer to farmer. But since they did not have too many staff, their reach was limited. But now because of Digital Green, they can reach out to more farmers. Rao says the response from the farmers has been good and the project has taken off well."

TEAM.TITLE: Stockholm Challenge Winner
TEAM.HEADLINE: Spread the Farmers word
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green won a Stockholm Challenge award! Digital Green was selected for a this year in the "Culture" category. The winners were not announced until the ceremony itself, on May 22, 2008. The Stockholm Challenge 2008 features a six category Award for ICT for Development projects. The best projects will win the prestigious Stockholm Challenge trophies and receive a 5.000 Euro stipend. Visit the Stockholm Challenge winners website for more details on the prize and check out Digital Green's Stockholm Challege entry submission."

TEAM.TITLE: SciDev.net
TEAM.HEADLINE: ICT for development projects honoured in Swedish awards
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green aims to use the Stockholm Challenge money to extend the reach of the project. They hope to establish a network of partnerships with other grassroots extension programmes."

TEAM.TITLE: NextBillion.net
TEAM.HEADLINE: ICT for development projects honoured in Swedish awards
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green aims to use the Stockholm Challenge money to extend the reach of the project. They hope to establish a network of partnerships with other grassroots extension programmes."

TEAM.TITLE: FARA
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video based approach for agricultural learning content
TEAM.DESC: "The video based approach has several important advantages to traditional forms of agricultural content, which is typically not in the local language, intended for a literate audience, uses expert terminology, lacks grassroots level practicalities, and remains inaccessible in a sea of scattered media. Farmers, by the nature of their occupation, rely on their auditory and visual senses and video, though not perfect, comes closest to capturing the scene in detail. Video creation tends to be faster and less expensive than other types of media, as advanced preparation in "lesson"-planning can minimize post-production editing. Video can compress the time needed to reveal the change. Video provides a means of bringing relevant demonstrations into the homes of farmers. Video also reduces the human resources required to follow-up with individual farmers and demonstrate time-consuming methods in the field."

TEAM.TITLE: Microsoft Unlimited Potential Group
TEAM.HEADLINE: The Human impact on Innovation
TEAM.DESC: "We jokingly call the project 'Farmer Idol,' because the farmers almost compete to appear in future videos."

TEAM.TITLE: Rising Voices
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video as a citizen Media Tool
TEAM.DESC: "Digital Green is a project of Microsoft Research that seeks to disseminate targeted agricultural information to small-scale, rural farmers in India through digital video. The system includes a digital video database, which is produced by farmers and experts. The content within this repository is meant to enable farmers to progressively improve their trade."

TEAM.TITLE: Think Change India
TEAM.HEADLINE: Video as a citizen Media Tool
TEAM.DESC: "Essentially, the project is a way to spread useful information to even illiterate farmers, using networks that they can trust (i.e. other villages, farmers in similar situations)."

TEAM.TITLE: Carnegie Mellon
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates - On Software, Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Giving Back
TEAM.DESC: "Sometimes the solutions aren't cool because of the technology. They're really cool because of the impact. One that I'll cite, we call Digital Green, which was done by our Indian research lab which has a particular focus on the needs of the 2 billion people at the bottom of the pyramid. They went out to the farmers and saw that a direct use of computing wouldn't be possible: no cell phone network and no electricity. The real problem is farming productivity. If you have a drought and didn't grow enough during the season before, you literally suffer malnutrition."

TEAM.TITLE: University of Waterloo
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates - On Software, Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Giving Back
TEAM.DESC: "This one thing we did with farmers, called Digital Green, was to take a camera and film farmers doing best practices, take those back for experts to look at and edit them, and then create DVDs that are carried out."

TEAM.TITLE: University of Chicago
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates - On Software, Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Giving Back
TEAM.DESC: "It's kind of like American Idol except this is about not starving."

TEAM.TITLE: Stanford University
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates - On Software, Innovation, Entrepreneurship and Giving Back
TEAM.DESC: "When our India lab opened up this research group about the poorest, the very poorest, who won't directly touch a personal computer, they were overwhelmed with people who were interested in joining it, and now they're spinning off NGOs like for this farmer training thing."

TEAM.TITLE: Chicago Tribune
TEAM.HEADLINE: Microsoft's Gates says computers not cure-all
TEAM.DESC: "using "DVD players that can be carried in and are battery operated is about as high-tech as you need in order to take to farmers and show them best practices," Gates said. With DVDs, "the adoption rate is three times what it was when we weren't using this approach."

TEAM.TITLE: Chicago Tribune
TEAM.HEADLINE: Gates urge help for 'bottom top'
TEAM.DESC: "But a project supported by the Gates Foundation produced a DVD showing how some farmers were able to improve their yields with better practices, and workers could take a battery-powered DVD player and TV set to different villages to show that video."

TEAM.TITLE: Post Gazzette
TEAM.HEADLINE: Gates urge help for 'bottom top'
TEAM.DESC: "But a project supported by the Gates Foundation produced a DVD showing how some farmers were able to improve their yields with better practices, and workers could take a battery-powered DVD player and TV set to different villages to show that video."

TEAM.TITLE: The Record
TEAM.HEADLINE: Bill Gates Asks Youth To Change The World
TEAM.DESC: "described a project where farmers' best practices were filmed. A DVD of their practices was made and taken, with a DVD player, for other farmers to see. Local farmers adopted the practices more frequently than they had before, and were anxious for their own techniques to be recorded. "It was doing better than American Idol, except it was Farmer Idol."

TEAM.TITLE: Imprint
TEAM.HEADLINE: Technology for the World
TEAM.DESC: "Bill Gates discussed the power of technology to assist in developing nations, using an initiative from the Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation to illustrate his point. The foundation, which has a focus on improving global health, development and education, used portable DVD players and videos made by the top farmers in the world to help educate farmers in Africa and so improve the yield of their crops."
